intro: Myrteola bullata var. pentamera, commonly known as the five-lobed myrteola, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known genera such as Eucalyptus and Syzygium. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and leathery, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
